2021 to date Hydrogen Council
Position: Director for Policy and Partnerships
Leading the Council’s work on hydrogen policy and advocacy: engagements with decisionmakers globally; delivering intelligence to members on the emerging regulatory frameworks for hydrogen across geographies.
Leading and managing the Hydrogen Sustainability Program comprising Task Teams on (i) international sustainability standards for hydrogen, (ii) hydrogen certification, (iii) SDG dimension of the hydrogen economy and reporting and disclosure standards for hydrogen projects.
Developing and maintaining partnerships and cooperation with international organisations, including the IEA, IRENA, IPHE, WBCSD and World Economic Forum.
Leading a dedicated workstream on contractual standardisation for hydrogen to develop template agreements for hydrogen SPAs based on delivery method.
2016 to 2021 European Federation of Energy Traders
2017 to 2021

Led EFET Carbon Neutrality Strategy and advocacy work on key legislative proposals under the European Green Deal.
2016 to 2017
Position: Carbon Markets Manager
2013 to 2016 European Energy Review Journal
Position: Chief Analyst – Natural Gas, LNG and Energy System Integration
Delivered analysis of natural gas market design in Europe, as well as the evolution of global LNG markets; presented and chaired at international energy conferences.
2012 to 2016 International Affairs Group, UK Government – Growth, Environment and Transport
2013 to 2016
Position: International Policy and Projects Officer
Provided liaison point for the UK stakeholders with the European Institutions and secured EU funding for priority areas of work for the Department of Growth, Environment and Transport, mostly funded by the European Regional Development Fund. Delivered intelligence support and analysis of relevant EU policies and regulations. Built partnerships and facilitated the development of project applications. Developed and managed EU-funded projects (e.g. on integration of offshore wind infrastructure in the North Sea); developed methodologies for knowledge transfer across project partners and communication strategies.
Aug to Dec 2012
Position: International Policy and Projects Specialist
COMMENT
An experienced policy and regulatory affairs advisor to industry C-suite leaders in hydrogen facing complex, multi-jurisdiction challenges. Her expertise lies in climate and energy policy and regulatory frameworks for hydrogen, as well as market design for wholesale energy commodity markets and environmental products, including carbon, guarantees of origin and sustainability certificates.
She has been working with senior executives across international energy companies helping them navigate the energy and climate policy landscape at global level, successfully delivering on their advocacy priorities. A public affairs expert by training, she is passionate about building coalitions and partnerships to advance public-private cooperation between industrial leaders and decision makers, as well as key intergovernmental organisations driving the energy, climate and sustainability agenda at international level.
